turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I have nothing left.  I have Nothing to give you.  I have no Pride, no dignity, no money.  I Don't even know how we'll make a Living.  But I promise I'll love You every second of your life.

turns.speaker: JOSEPHINE
turns.text: Don't worry, Wyatt.  My family's rich.

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: What can I get you?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Let me have one of those cigars.  Kinda nice in here.  You run it?

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: Milt Joyce, owner-operator.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Well, excuse me for askin', Milt, But isn't it kinda dead in here?

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: You see that bird at the faro Table?  That's Johnny Tyler.  He Barged in here one day, said he Was takin' over the game, started Slappin' customer, wavin' his Gun around, scarin' off all the High-class play.  Only trade comes In here now's just bummers and Drovers, just the dregs.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Why don't you get rid of him and Get yourself straight dealer?

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: Well sure, neighbor, easy to say.

turns.speaker: JOYCE
turns.text: Those Cowboys're tellin' Everybody in town they're gonna Clean you out.  They're down in That lot right now behind the OK Corral.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Don't worry, Doc, it's not your problem. You don't have to mix up in this.

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: Wyatt, I couldn't find a single Store that had laudanum any-

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Mattie, they're here!  Folks this Is Celia Ann but you can call her Mattie.  Or even Mrs.  Earp if you Prefer.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Come up to the fire, honey.

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: I think I'll just lie down awhile

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: Long as I live I'll never Get used to that sound.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: They're just lonely is all.  Hell, I howl myself sometimes.

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: You get lonely?

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: No, stay.  Please stay with me.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Honey, I gotta start makin' money.

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: Oh, all right.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Well I guess I don't have to go Right now.  I guess I could stay a little while.

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: No, no, I don't want to keep you.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: No really, I can stay a while.

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: Just go.  It's all right.  Wyatt, Really.  Work well.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: All right, well, good night.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: That the bottle Lou gave you? Better go easy on that stuff.

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: I know what I'm doing.  Where have You been?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Out ridin'.  So... how you doin'?

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: I don't know.  I'm all right.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Really?  You sure?

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: Sure I'm sure.  What is this?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Well, I was thinking, we've Already made a pile of money. Maybe we should just pull up Stakes and move on.  And we could Stay on the move, you know?  Just Keep going, see the world.  Live On room service the rest of our Lives.  How'd that be?

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: Wyatt, what're you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Just thinkin' out loud.  Forget it.

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: Thought you swore you'd never Carry that thing again.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Yeah, well, I swore a lot of things.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Mattie.  What about this?

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: I need it.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: 'Least you admit it.

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: Admit what, I'm an opium fiend? No, Wyatt, I just said I need it. I need something to keep me warm At night.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Look, Mattie, I know you're-

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: You know nothing.  What you don't Know would fill a book.  Jesus, I Feel like it's when you're around I need it most.  You're never Yourself, you never relax.  Never. Everything's so stiff and dead. You always have to keep a rein on Everything, ever yourself.  Oh, You smile sometimes, I've even Seen you laugh.  But there's no Light in your smile for me, Wyatt, nothing to keep me warm. And I get cold, Wyatt.  I get so cold.  What's between you and that Jew woman?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: All right, look.  I can make it Right, I can make this up to you, Mattie.  I can, I swear.

turns.speaker: MATTIE
turns.text: Will you go to her and tell her Right in front of me she's Nothing to you?  Right out loud so I can hear?  Tell her she's Nothing, tell her she's nobody, Just dirt?  Will you do that?

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Well hello, Sherm.

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: You wanted to talk?

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Yeah, kinda, wanted to see if you'd join back up with us.

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: That what you got me up here for?

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: You're a Cowboy, you're a Brother.  Come back, no hard Feelings.

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: Forget it, Ringo.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: Isn't there anything I can say That'll change your mind?  You're Gonna stay with your new friends?

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: 'Least they don't scare women.

turns.speaker: RINGO
turns.text: You're the boss.  One thing, though.

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: Run for your lives, boys!  It's That great two-gun dog-catcher From Kansas!

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: McMasters, isn't it?  Listen, you Seen a black stallion with-

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: Look, I got a rule.  I don't talk To lawmen.  Dog-catchers neither.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I'm not a lawman, I'm just a Private citizen getting' my Property back

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: Well in that case, I saw your Horse.  Billy Clanton was takin' Him up to the Cut to show him Off.  The boys're all up there Right now, branding.  And in a Mood.  Still want your property Back, Mr. Private Citizen?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: So what about you Cowboys anyway?

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: If I had to explain it you Wouldn't understand.  Just say We're brothers to the bone.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Yeah, but some of the things they Say your brothers've done...

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: There's all kinds of horses, Ain't there?  Same with Cowboys. What they do's their affair.  I Don't preach and I don't judge.  I Ain't no dog-catcher.

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: No, wait.  Please.  I know nothin' I say'll fix things but I want You to know it wasn't me.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: No?  Brothers to the bone, right?

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: Not anymore, not after this.

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: I ain't your brother, I ain't None of your damn brothers.  Move!

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: All right, run 'em off.

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: Florentino!  He's getting away!

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Drop his horse.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I know that cut.  You mean there's A waterhole near there?

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: But this time they'll be ready.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: We'll see about that.

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: What'd you do that for?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: So he can tell the story.

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: Next waterhole's Black Draw.  We Could be there by mid-morning.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: They're wise by now.  Which is Next, Iron Springs?  Yeah, let's Try there, Iron Springs.

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: There they are.  No herd though.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: We'll go around that way, come up on foot.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I don't like it.

turns.speaker: MCMASTERS
turns.text: Might as well hear him out. Anyways, what choice we got?  But no matter what happens, see It through to the end.  If you don't I'll curse the day I ever laid eyes on you.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Well how do we look?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Hey!  Virgil!  My God!  Morgan!  Hey, Boy!  You look great!  Both of you!

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Give him some good exercise?  Sure Some stud.  Some string in fact. What're you gonna do, race 'em?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Hope so.  Clean up with this boy.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Boy, look at all those stars.  Bet You can see every star there is. Practical touch 'em.  Kinda makes You think, you know?  I mean you Look up and you think God made All that but he still remembered To make a little speck like me. Kinda flattering really.  Hey, Wyatt, you believe in God?  No, Come on, really, do you?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Maybe, yeah.  Hell, I don't know.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Well what do you think happens When you die?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Got me.  Somethin'.  Nothin'.  I Don't know.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: I read this book, book on Spiritualism...

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Really?  What about hell?  They got A sign or what?

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Hey, Wyatt, God damn it, I'm serious!

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Wyatt, meet Fred White, he's town marshal.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Lotta law around here.  Just met the Sheriff.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: It's that woman from the coach!

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I'll be damned...

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Hey Doc!  Come on now.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Just his style, Morg.  Doesn't Mean anything.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Listen to me, both of you.  This Is no good.  This is trouble we Don't need.  For the first time in Our lives we got a chance to stop Wandering and finally be a Family.  Do this and you throw it All away.  You saw what happened To Fred White.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Come on, we're not about pickin' Fights.  Just gonna keep a little Order, that's all.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Like you said, just gotta know How to handle 'em.  Old Fred Wasn't up to it.  We know that We're doin', Wyatt.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: All right, say you're right, say You don't get yourself killed. There's something else.  It's too late for Virge, he Already rolled his bone.  But it's Not too late for you, Morg.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: What're you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Doc won't quit, been up 36 hours. Clanton came in an hour ago, they Switched over to poker.  Tried to Get him to bed but he just won't Let go.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I know.  And nobody can make him.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: How you doin', boy?

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Fine.  Better.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: You were right.  It's nothin' like I thought.  I almost wish...

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I know, kid.  I know.  Me too.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Dropped him, that was it.  Sorry If I made a worse mess for you.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I'm the one made a mess.  Made a Right fair mess of the whole thing.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: That thunder's sure somethin'.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: That didn't sound like thunder.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Get down, boy.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Morgan, are you crazy?  They're Out gunning for us!  What the Hell're you doin'?

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: What's it look like?  They want a Piece of me they can come and get It, I'm not crawlin' into my hole.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Morg, use your head.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: I am usin' it, Wyatt.  Been Wonderin' how the hell we got in This tangle.  You know they hit Clum's house, too?  Shot up his wife. His wife.  Who ever heard of That?  Men sneakin' around in the Dark, back-shootin', scarin' Women?  They're bugs, Wyatt.  You Know all your smart talk about Live and let live?  Ain't no live And let live with bugs.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I know, I was wrong.  But Morg, Look, we got to get out.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Listen to yourself, Wyatt.  Lie Down and crawl or you might get Hurt?  What kinda talk is that? That's Virgil lyin' over there, Wyatt.  Our own brother.  Ruined For life.  No sir, I ain't going No place.  You want to go, fine. I'm stayin' right here and have It out with those bastards.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I just got it fixed.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: You're on.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: You were right, Wyatt.  They got Me good.  Don't let 'em get you Too.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Will somebody get the damn dog out-

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Remember about the light you're Supposed to see when you're dyin'?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Easy Morg, don't think about that now.

turns.speaker: MORGAN
turns.text: Isn't true.  I can't see a damn thing.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: You back that Queen again, you Son of a bitch, I'll blow you Right out of that chair!  Somethin' on your mind?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Just wanted to let you know You're sitting in my chair.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: That a fact?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Yeah.  It's a fact.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: For a man that don't go heeled You run your mouth kinda reckless.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Don't need to go heeled to get The bulge on a dub like you.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: That a fact?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Yeah.  It's a fact.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Well I'm real scared.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Go ahead.  Skin it.  Skin that Smoke wagon and see what happens.

turns.speaker: TYLER
turns.text: Listen Mister, I'm getting' tired-

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Easy, gents. Private affair...  Wyatt! Doc! Hey!

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Jack...

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Way ahead of you, Wyatt.  You want Us to help you get Ike Clanton And Johnny Behan.  Everybody knows They're the ones to blame for Your brothers.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: They're nothing.  They're nobody. I want the Cowboys.  All of 'em.  I Mean to break 'em up, drive 'em Out of the territory.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Got a sheaf of federal warrants. Being in the Territories it's up To our discretion how they're Served.  That means we got the Cowboys without quarter.  The Black flag, brother.  No Prisoners, no mercy, amen.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: 500... Year's wages.  And I never even saw a horse like that.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Talked it over.  We decided we Don't need the money.  Took out 13 Dollars each, though.  Federal Posseman's fee.  That all right?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Sure...

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: We should get moving.

turns.speaker: VERMILLION
turns.text: Doc's just in no kinda shape.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Allie-girl...And Louisa!  You're So lovely.  I'm at your feet, Darlin'.  Just at your feet.  Guess it's only right.  Ma always Said you were the prettiest.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: But she doted on the frowner

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Look at that.  Busted.  Brand new Money Ward, too.  33 years old And I don't even have a decent Watch.  'Bout time I started Lookin' out for myself.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Well here we are a family again. Been so long plain forgot how Good it feels.  Want to thank you For that, Wyatt.  All your doin'.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: We're gonna do it, boys.  Gonna Get ours.  Feel it in my bones. All we have to do is keep our Eyes on that brass ring.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Well that's your problem.  Hey Virge, see anything of Doc while You were in Prescott?

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Hit a streak when we left.  Him And Kate.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Look pretty rough.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Just like any other hard cases. Gotta know how to handle 'em.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Well we're off and running.  Just Acquired us a quarter-interest in The game at the Oriental.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Acquired?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: So to speak.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Her maiden name was Sullivan.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Better go with 'em, honey.  Here's Where I leave you.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Keep your eye on that brass ring. Don't let anything side-track you.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: I know, I need a keeper.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: You know, I was thinkin', maybe We ought to open our own place. That's the real money.  Build it Up, milk it for all it's worth, Then sell it off for a bundle and Breeze out of this burg with more Money than Croesus and ready to Live like kings.  Let's you and me Take a walk around town, Virge, See if we can scout us out a Couple of nice lots.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: I can't hardly believe it.  It's Working out just like you said, Wyatt.  We're lootin' this burg Six ways through Sunday.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Pretty fun too, isn't it?

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Kinda, actually, yeah.  I gotta admit.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: I couldn't help it, Wyatt.  I Looked at that woman and it was Just like somebody slapping me in The face.  I mean these people're Afraid to even walk down the Street and I'm trying to make Money off it like some kind of God damn vulture.  That's not me, That's somebody I don't even know.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Virgil, please.  Don't do this to me.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: It's got nothin' to do with you, Wyatt.  It's-

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Nothing to do with me?  I'm your Brother for Christ's sake.  God, I Don't believe this.  Talk to him, will you?  Or hit him.  Oh no, don't tell me...

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Maybe I jumped the gun.  Maybe Those Cowboys aren't near as bad As they're painted.  You know I Was thinkin', there's a lot of Money in the cattle business...

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Wait a minute, you thinkin' of Getting in bed with the Cowboys?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Business is business.  Don't have To love 'em to work with 'em.  Not If there's money in it.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: You are the one, Wyatt.  You sure are.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Billy Clanton, Wes Fuller, and Billy Claiborne.  Now there's six Of 'em.  This is like a bad dream.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Just stay calm, use your head. It'll be all right.  Just the Same, though...  Guess you better swear me in.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Here they are again.  Look at 'em.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Easy, Virge, they're just tryin' To egg us on.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Wait till the liquor wears off. Once they start getting headaches They'll lose interest.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Wyatt, they're threatening our lives.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: You'll never make that stick.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: They're carrying guns in town.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Virge, that's a misdemeanor.  You Go down there to arrest 'em, Something goes wrong, maybe this Time somebody gets his head Broke, suddenly it's a mess and It won't end there, you'll have Cowboys comin' around lookin' for Trouble from here to Christmas. You gonna risk all that over a Misdemeanor?

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: No, damn it, it's wrong, they're Breakin' the law.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: All right, Virge, your call.  But Give Doc the shotgun.  They'll be Less apt to get nervy if they see Him on the street howitzer.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Virge, you're makin' the arrest. You make contact, I'll back you Up.  Morgan'll back me up, Doc'll Keep an eye out for trouble.  And Keep your hands on your guns. They even look like they're gonna Start something, buffalo 'em. Right over the head.

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Wyatt, I know what I'm doin'.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Look at 'em all.  They love it. How in the hell'd we get Ourselves into this?

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Getting late.  Guess I'll turn in.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Bundle up, Virge.  Cold out there.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Virgil?

turns.speaker: VIRGIL
turns.text: Wyatt...

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: What about all these saloons?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Ah, now that's the real mother- Lode in Tombstone.  Up and down Allen Street, full-blast 24 hours A day, liquor, hostesses, Gamblin', makin' money hand over Fist.  All except the Oriental.  On Account of the element.  Have a Man for breakfast in there most Days.  Regular slaughter house. High-rollers won't go near it. Too bad, nice place.

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: See what I mean about it getting Spooky?

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Curly Bill, huh?  Who was that Other idiot?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: Ike Clanton, Old Man's eldest Son.  Know he ain't got the stuff, Makes him miserable.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Yeah, and dangerous.

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: Why don't you just leave it alone?

turns.speaker: WHITE
turns.text: No, I gotta do something.  I don't Suppose you'd card-

turns.speaker: WYATT
turns.text: None of my business, Fred.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: ... What were you saying, Admiral? Something about this 'not being a job for a wine-sniffing, skirt-chasing playboy spy?'

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL ROEBUCK
turns.text: - I'll be sure to acknowledge 007's 'assistance' in my report to the Prime Minister. But this is, still, a naval operation.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: What do they say in Russia, General Bukharin?

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: But -

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL ROEBUCK
turns.text: - Thank you, M. But this is more than your man can handle.  Are we in agreement?

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL ROEBUCK
turns.text: I appreciate your assistance, M. But this is now a military operation.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Bring up the tracking satellite. And get 007 out of there.

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL ROEBUCK
turns.text: It's too late -

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: GET BOND OUT OF THERE.

turns.speaker: MINISTER JOHNSTONE
turns.text: Good evening. I've just spoken with the Prime Minister at the economic summit in Tokyo; he's expecting a full update within the hour.  For those of you still unaware, some forty minutes ago -

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL ROEBUCK
turns.text: Excuse me, but -  I must formally protest this meeting. Given the nature of what's occurred - and the need for secrecy - I see no reason to involve the air force, the army, or MI-6.  This is an internal affair that should be handled strictly by the officers of her Majesty's Royal Navy.

turns.speaker: MINISTER JOHNSTONE
turns.text: Admiral, are you suggesting -

turns.speaker: MINISTER JOHNSTONE
turns.text: Why wasn't the ship protected?!?! Why was it sailing without radar?

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL ROEBUCK
turns.text: I resent your tone, sir. I have men who are missing -

turns.speaker: MINISTER JOHNSTONE
turns.text: And I have the entire British economy to worry about.

turns.speaker: MINISTER JOHNSTONE
turns.text: At least we know where the gold is. When are the recovery ships due?

turns.speaker: ADMIRAL ROEBUCK
turns.text: 36 hours. They've already sailed from the Persian gulf.

turns.speaker: MINISTER JOHNSTONE
turns.text: I expect to have that gold recovered in 36 hours. Until then, I'm imposing my own electronic silence: For the sake of the economy, not a word to NATO, the press, the CIA.  ...And so long as Commander Bond here seems to be such an expert on these matters, I want him to go along as an observer. Are we agreed?

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Always nice to meet one of her Majesty's fellow subjects...  Especially one with such distinguished friends.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: You might say I've always been one of Mr. Valentin's biggest followers.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: It's a beautiful boat, Sir Elliot. Practically glows in the dark.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: I can tell you're a man with an eye for exquisite possessions, Mr. Bond.  Darling! Come here.  I want you to meet my wife.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: I hope you've enjoyed this little charade.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Which part? The Colonel's? Or yours?

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: A piece of advice, Mr. Bond: Don't screw with a man who buys ink by the ton.  It's deadlier than uranium.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: We'll see about that.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: How did you get this number?

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Oh, please, Mr. Bond. We live in the information age! Information is currency - and with the right currency, you can have any piece of information.  Besides I own the phone company. What do you say? Twenty minutes?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I'm on my way.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Mr. Bond! Nice to see you.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Sir Elliot.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Come. Let's get out of the noise.  - I'll give you a tour of the building, then we'll talk.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Before I became involved with Paris, she was always involved with the most inappropriate' men...  Playboys. Thrill seekers. Middle aged Peter Pans who only brought out the worst in her.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: I tried to save her. But she remained a manic depressive: Fits, inappropriate behavior... Delusions of grandeur.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I wonder if it runs in the family.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: The only difference between a psychopath and a genius, Mr. Bond, is the degree of success.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Still, I do miss her. I only wish she could have lived to see all this.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I can feel your pain.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: By the way - what is it that brings you to Kuala Lumpur, Mister Bond?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Sightseeing.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: I call this the Rogue's gallery.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Yes. I can see: You've hung the rest of your relatives.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: My third great Uncle - the Earl of Aberdeen - negotiated the purchase of Hong Kong from the Chinese.  His son-in-law - George Harmsway - made the first family fortune, running opium into Shanghai...  His son, Thomas, who lost it, smoking the opium... And my grandfather Henry, who opened the first telegraph station, and published the colony's first English newspaper.  It was a city of unlimited possibility.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: So why did you leave?

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Because it's a dying city. Since the Chinese take-over, who knows what can happen tomorrow?  In any case, this is my father, Charles: A royal bastard who started the first radio and television stations. Said I'd never amount to anything, but...  I turned it into this

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Welcome to the new world order, Mr. Bond.  Churchill had his armies; Caesar had his legions; I have my divisions:  News, sports, business, entertainment. And these are my foot soldiers:  2000 people working on 14 floors to feed 300 newspapers, 4 cable news networks, 87 magazines, and 29 different cable TV channels - in 35 languages.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: And still not a thing to watch.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ...Although it must be fun to have all those satellites.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: They're merely tools to disseminate information.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Or disinformation... If you wanted to, say, beam down a signal to send a ship off course? Maybe one degree a minute?

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Fantastic idea Mr. Bond! Perhaps I should buy it for a book! It's totally preposterous, but -  You amuse me. ...And now perhaps I can amuse you.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: You see, Mr. Bond, you and I are both men of action. But your era is passing. Words are the new weapons; satellites the new artillery. And make no mistake about it: In the right hands, they can be as deadly as your Walther PPK.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ...Words to live by?

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Your choice.  Look at the time! Come. There's someone I want you meet - about a story I'm thinking of publishing.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Briefly.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Don't pout, Sidney. I invited him here hoping he might shed some light on your story. He's from 'Lloyd's of London.'  ...Aren't you, Mr. Bond?

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: ...And what's that, my dear?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Sidney, perhaps we should leave this to -

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I'm sure they will.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Good-bye, Mister Bond.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Are your guards really going to kill a helpless girl?

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: My guards are from South Africa, Mr. Bond. This is their chance to get even with the formerly 'Great' Britain.  Now both of you. Put your hands on your heads, and step forward.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ...So that's what the weapons grade uranium was for.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Precisely, Mr. Bond. In a matter of minutes, the boring device will arrive at the core of the reactor...  And when the radioactive blades cut into the plutonium -

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: - Instant melt-down.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Chernobyl will look like a campfire.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: ...As the advertising says: Tomorrow never lies.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: What about the gold?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I'd rather die alone.

turns.speaker: HARMSWAY
turns.text: Take the girl. Leave the handcuffs. We'll drown her at sea.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN CHEONG
turns.text: In the Strait of Malacca, when a boat is even five minutes late, one begins to worry, Mr. Bond.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I know. Pirates from Sumatra want the cargo; smugglers from Thailand and Burma want the ships.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN CHEONG
turns.text: Sometimes kill the crew; other times -  Torture them.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN CHEONG
turns.text: The Kuala Lumpur ferry was 35 miles off-course that night. Captain blamed the auto-pilot; I suspected he was drunk - until the Sumatra ferry captain had same problem.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Did you test the auto-pilots? The satellite positioning receiver?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN CHEONG
turns.text: Next morning. Both boats. Nothing wrong.  My 90 year old grandfather thinks 'Ghost in the computer - Silicon Dragon.'

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I appreciate your time -

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN CHEONG
turns.text: Maybe you should talk to Sidney Winch. Owns a marine salvage company. Nobody knows more about the Strait.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Where can I find him?

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN CHEONG
turns.text: Him? He, is a she -  at the bar.

turns.speaker: MONEYPENNY
turns.text: I'm sure she is, James. But I'm afraid you'll have to 'kiss off' the rest of your lessons this afternoon.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Moneypenny... Here I was, finally getting a feel for a new tongue -

turns.speaker: MONEYPENNY
turns.text: Four o'clock. M will meet you in the conference room.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: 4:30. It may take me a little longer to wrap things up here.

turns.speaker: MONEYPENNY
turns.text: Four o'clock. Don't be late.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Tsi tien, Chien-penny.

turns.speaker: MONEYPENNY
turns.text: Ah, James. You always were a cunning linguist... Au revoir, mon cher.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Moneypenny! We've got to stop meeting like this. They may be on to us.

turns.speaker: MONEYPENNY
turns.text: Hello, James. Enjoy your meeting?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: In the darkest moments, it's what I live for. Especially since I've heard how much you like to watch... On the hidden camera.

turns.speaker: MONEYPENNY
turns.text: By the way, James: Ordinarily I would never ask, but... Weren't you and that Colonel once stranded on a raft for two weeks in the Sargasso Sea?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Moneypenny! How indiscreet! Have you ever known me to kiss and tell?

turns.speaker: MONEYPENNY
turns.text: Actually, I've never known you to do either... But -

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: - We all want what we can't have?

turns.speaker: MONEYPENNY
turns.text: Not all of us, 007.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: What - no lust for adventure?

turns.speaker: MONEYPENNY
turns.text: No, 007. It's just that I've learned from personal experience - that when we get what we want -  Somehow the reality is never as... Satisfying as the fantasy.
